channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: ‘SNL’ has always taken on politics. Here’s what works – and why
item.description: As a historic election looms, Saturday Night Live faces an ongoing challenge to make America laugh – and process an increasingly strange political world. Jean Smart hosts the show’s 50th season premiere on Saturday.
item.content:encoded:
As a historic election looms, Saturday Night Live faces an ongoing challenge to make America laugh – and process an increasingly strange political world. Jean Smart hosts the show’s 50th season premiere on Saturday.

(Image credit: Dana Edelson)
item.dc:creator: Eric Deggans

item.title: Why the price of eggs is on the rise again
item.description: The price of eggs has risen by about 28% in the past year, largely due to outbreaks of avian flu. Those prices could continue to climb during the holidays, as demand for baked goods increases.
item.content:encoded:
The price of eggs has risen by about 28% in the past year, largely due to outbreaks of avian flu. Those prices could continue to climb during the holidays, as demand for baked goods increases.

(Image credit: Terry Chea)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Opinion: Remembering the marvel, Maggie Smith
item.description: Jean Brodie, Minerva McGonagall, Violet Crawley: Maggie Smith embodied these memorable roles on stage and screen. NPR's Scott Simon has a remembrance of the actor, who died yesterday at the age of 89.
item.content:encoded:
Jean Brodie, Minerva McGonagall, Violet Crawley: Maggie Smith embodied these memorable roles on stage and screen. NPR's Scott Simon has a remembrance of the actor, who died yesterday at the age of 89.

(Image credit: Evening Standard/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: VP debates may alter a close race’s dynamic even when they don't predict the winner
item.description: Vice presidential debates have produced many memorable moments, but it’s hard to say any has made a decisive difference in the election outcome. It’s worth recalling how much media heat and drama they have generated.
item.content:encoded:
Vice presidential debates have produced many memorable moments, but it’s hard to say any has made a decisive difference in the election outcome. It’s worth recalling how much media heat and drama they have generated.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images; Justin Sullivan/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Ron Elving

item.title: 5 things to know from this week’s big report on cannabis
item.description: More Americans now use pot on a daily basis than alcohol. A sweeping new report says the federal government needs to better understand the risks to the public and get involved.
item.content:encoded:
More Americans now use pot on a daily basis than alcohol. A sweeping new report says the federal government needs to better understand the risks to the public and get involved.

(Image credit: Jim Mone)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Hezbollah confirms its top leader was killed after Israeli airstrikes
item.description: The militant group confirmed the death of its longtime leader Hassan Nasrallah in Beirut. The development marks a significant escalation many fear is inching towards a larger regional war.
item.content:encoded:
The militant group confirmed the death of its longtime leader Hassan Nasrallah in Beirut. The development marks a significant escalation many fear is inching towards a larger regional war.

(Image credit: Chris McGrath)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: Meet the astronauts preparing to travel farther from Earth than any human before
item.description: This time next year, NASA plans to send its first crewed mission to the moon. NPR visited the facility to find out how the astronauts are preparing for this high stakes exploration.
item.content:encoded:
This time next year, NASA plans to send its first crewed mission to the moon. NPR visited the facility to find out how the astronauts are preparing for this high stakes exploration.

(Image credit: Danielle Villasana for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Israel strikes Hezbollah in blast targeting the militant group's leader
item.description: Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah was said to be the target of the strikes, but it was not immediately clear if he was at the site when they happened.
item.content:encoded:
Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah was said to be the target of the strikes, but it was not immediately clear if he was at the site when they happened.

(Image credit: Hassan Ammar)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A weakened Helene brings 'catastrophic' flooding as it crosses southern Appalachians
item.description: Helene, now a post-tropical cyclone, continues to flood parts of North Carolina and the Tennessee Valley. Dozens of storm-related deaths were reported in Florida, Georgia and the Carolinas.
item.content:encoded:
Helene, now a post-tropical cyclone, continues to flood parts of North Carolina and the Tennessee Valley. Dozens of storm-related deaths were reported in Florida, Georgia and the Carolinas.

(Image credit: Phelan M. Ebenhack)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Justice Department sues Alabama, claiming it purged voters too close to the election
item.description: In a new lawsuit, the Justice Department claims Alabama violated federal law by systematically removing voters fewer than 90 days before a federal election.
item.content:encoded:
In a new lawsuit, the Justice Department claims Alabama violated federal law by systematically removing voters fewer than 90 days before a federal election.

(Image credit: Butch Dill)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang
